page.title: 11 Yardley Chase
page.content: Yardley Hastings is surrounded by the remains of the forests of old England. In the 12th.century all woods were classified as 1)forests owned by the Crown and where the harsh forest laws applied,2)the Chases where the King granted hunting rights to a local Lord and where only a few of the forest laws were applied and 3)the Parks or enclosed areas where none of the forest laws were applied Yardley Chase has been leased to the Forestry Commision since approximatly 1930 and along with the neighbouring Salcey Forest ,which remained a Crown forest, have been managed under the old Domesday name for the area as {Wymersley Forest}.The Chase is famous for its oak trees,{Cowpers oak} which had a girth of 22.5 feet,and the much larger{ Gog and Magog oaks},of which only one still exists.
